sentences.english: On the trail the women talked excitedly about the future.
sentences.chinese: 走在崎嶇的小道上，兩個女人眉飛色舞地談論着未來。

sentences.english: The Rocky Mountains have rugged mountains and roads.
sentences.chinese: 落基山脈有崇山峻嶺和崎嶇不平的道路。

sentences.english: In the central regions you'll encounter rugged land and rolling hills.
sentences.chinese: 在中部地區，你會遇到崎嶇的土地和連綿起伏的丘陵。

sentences.english: If the answer is no one, then society may have a rough road ahead.
sentences.chinese: 如果答案是沒有人，那這個社會的前路將十分崎嶇。

sentences.english: The economy is in the midst of a very rough patch. The worst is probably still ahead.
sentences.chinese: 經濟仍在崎嶇不平的路途中，最壞的事情還沒發生。

sentences.english: Those who climb the Western Steps experience a more rugged climb.
sentences.chinese: 而選擇攀登西面梯道，則要經受崎嶇不平的梯級。

sentences.english: The ragged rascal ran around the rugged rocks round and round.
sentences.chinese: 衣着檻褸的流氓圍着崎嶇的岩石轉了又轉。

sentences.english: The road to the ancient home of the glass Christmas tree bauble is a long and treacherous one.
sentences.chinese: 這條通往玻璃聖誕樹古屋的路是一條崎嶇而漫長的路。

sentences.english: Millstones had been cut and laboriously sledged down the rough mountainsides .
sentences.chinese: 石磨被琢好，然後費力用雪橇運下那崎嶇不平的山坡。

sentences.english: The other picture had mountains， too. But these were  rugged and  bare.
sentences.chinese: 另一幅畫也有山脈，但卻崎嶇不平，而且光禿禿的。

sentences.english: This bumpy, meandering byway is difficult to negotiate.
sentences.chinese: 這條崎嶇的羊腸小道非常難走。

sentences.english: The cart jolted along the rough road.
sentences.chinese: 馬車在崎嶇不平的道路上顛簸行進。

sentences.english: The road of justice is rugged and only welcomes brae people.
sentences.chinese: 正義的路是崎嶇的路，它只歡迎勇敢的人。

sentences.english: The car jolted badly over the rough road.
sentences.chinese: 汽車在崎嶇的道路上顛得很厲害。

sentences.english: These rough roads soon wear the tread of motorcycle tyres off.
sentences.chinese: 這些崎嶇不平的路很快把摩托車胎面磨平了。

sentences.english: Years ago, local villagers could only descend the village’s mountain on a dangerous path.
sentences.chinese: 多年前，郭亮村村民只能從一個崎嶇險峻的小徑下山。

definition: to pass over mountains ridges (idiom); fig. hardships of the journey
continuous/unbroken/uninterrupted/extending forever into the distance (of mountain range, river etc)
topography of a mountain/features of a mountain
wind and rain/the elements/trials and hardships
the road one must follow or take/the only way/same as 必由之路[bi4 you2 zhi1 lu4]
